title: Deadly Nightshade
provenance_text:
Marc Mendelson [1915-2013], Brussels, Belgium, until November 1952 [1]; G. David Thompson [1899-1965], Pittsburgh, PA [2]; his gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, April 1953.

Notes:
[1]. The painting was no. 176 in "The 1952 Pittsburgh International Exhibition of Contemporary Paintings" held at Carnegie Institute, October-December 1952.
[2]. Mr. Thompson purchased the painting from the International (as a gift for Carnegie Institute) for 30,000 Belgian Francs ($606) in November 1952. It was accessioned on December 11, 1952 (see copies of relevant correspondence in curatorial file.)
